post.summary: Create target group based on alternate currencies
post.description: Create a target group/milestone based on alternate currencies.

active.description: Indicate if the target is active.

description.description: Brief description of the target. The character limit for the description is 255 characters and special characters are supported.

name.description: Name for the target. The name can be up to 200 characters long, supports special characters, and is case-insensitive.

preferredTillId.description: Identifier for the preferred or primary POS till for the target.

trackingType.description: Type of tracking the milestone is created for.

targetEvaluationType.description: Defines the type of time frame used for evaluating the target.

totalPeriods.description: Total number of period cycles for the target group.

frequencyType.description: Frequency of each cycle in which the user has to achieve the target value

frequency.description: Number of units corresponding to the selected frequencyType For example: If frequencyType is DAILY and frequency is 10, the cycle spans ten days.

recurringCycles.description: Total number of cycles defined for the target group. Once a cycle is complete, the target is reset for the new cycle. A maximum of 100 cycles can be defined for a target group.

periods.description: An object containing details on the target period creation, updates, and time-frame.

endDate.description: End date and time of the period in ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS format. Example: 2024-10-24T23:59:00.000.

periodStatus.description: Indicate if the cycle of the Milestone is running or upcoming.

refCode.description: A reference code for the period.

startDate.description: Start date and time of the period in ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSS format. Example: 2024-10-24T00:00:00.000

targets.description: An object containing details on the targets in the target group.

expression.description: Indicate if the target has an expression for evaluation.

expressionJson.description: A JSON expression that specifies the conditions required to achieve the target. The expression is generated in the backend.

filters.description: An object containing details on the scope filters active on the target.

targetEntity.description: KPI on which the target is tracked.

enrolmentMethod.description: Method of enrolment for the target.

defaultValues.description: An object containing details of the default values for the target.

extendedFieldInfo.description: An object containing details on the extended field information for the target group.

alternateCurrencyIdentifier.description: Unique identifier of the alternate currency that is generated when creating an alternate currency.

programId.description: Unique ID of the loyalty program that includes the alternate currency.

message.example: Target rule metadata is required in case of EXTENDED_FIELD/ALTERNATE_CURRENCIES target type
Invalid or null Alternate Currency Identifier for target rule

get.description: This API returns user related information for Milestones/Streaks, by taking a user-ID as the input.

parameters.name: targetRuleIds
parameters.description: Rule ID of the target. To fetch the information of a particular target in the API response.

parameters.name: trackingDate
parameters.description: The date when the target was created. ISO 8601 format

parameters.name: enrollmentType
parameters.description: The target enrollment type refers to the method used to enroll customers and set target values.  Possible values are: TRANSACTION, IMPORT, and AUDIENCE_FILTER.   TRANSACTION: Enroll loyalty customers who transact during the target period.  IMPORT: Import a list of customers with custom target values.  AUDIENCE_FILTER: Create audience groups using a predefined audience filter.

parameters.name: includeOnlyUserCreated
parameters.description: Include only the user-created targets. A user-created target is a promotion that rewards customers for achieving goals they set themselves.

parameters.name: targetGroupId
parameters.description: Group ID for which target needs to retrieve.

parameters.name: targetGroupId
parameters.description: Group Id of the target

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: Unique id of the target present in the above group

post.description: This API helps in both updating and inserting the target communication based on the given "target id" and "target group id".

parameters.name: targetGroupId
parameters.description: Group id of the target group

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: Unique target id present in the above group

active.description: Pass true to make the communication active.

channelId.description: Unique ID of the channel through which the communication needs to be sent.

communicationType.description: Type of the communication. Values: START, FINISH, CHANGE, REMINDER.

messageTemplate.description: Content that should go in the message.

sender.description: Sender ID from which the communication needs to go.

parameters.description: Group ID of the target to delete.

parameters.description: Group ID for which target periods need to be added

active.description: Current status of the target period. true for active, false for inactive.

description.description: Short description of the target period.

startDate.description: Duration of the target period in ISO standard timestamp between startDate and endDate.

endDate.description: Duration of the target period in ISO standard timestamp between startDate and endDate.

refCode.description: Reference code of the target period.

parameters.description: Group ID for which target period needs to be updated.

id.description: Unique ID of the target period to modify.

active.description: Current status of the target period. true for active, false for inactive.

description.description: Short description of the target period.

startDate.description: Duration of the target period in ISO standard timestamp between startDate and endDate.

endDate.description: Duration of the target period in ISO standard timestamp between startDate and endDate.

refCode.description: Reference code of the target period.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Group ID for which target needs to be added.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Group ID for which target needs to be added.

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: Id of the target that need to be modified

enrolmentMethod.description: How to enroll customers and add target values. Values: TRANSACTION (enroll loyalty customers who transacts during the target period), IMPORT (to import a list of customers with custom target value).

expressionJson.description: Condition (rule expression) to be evaluated based for the chosen targetEntity.

filters.description: Restrict the target to specific stores.

entityIds.description: Pass the unique IDs of selected entityType. For example, if entityType is STORES, pass the applicable store IDs in entityIds.

entityType.description: Entity by which the target is restricted. Values: STORE, ZONE, CONCEPT.

name.description: Name of the target. Modifying the name is not recommended as it may lead to issues in loyalty promotions.

targetEntity.description: Entity to define target condition. Values: TRANSACTION, LINEITEM, POINTS. For example, pass LINEITEM to define condition on the transaction line item.

targetGroupId.description: Unique ID of the target group associated with the target.

targetType.description: Transaction parameter to consider for the target. Values: QUANTITY, SALES, COUNT, VISIT.

post.summary: Enrol/Re-enrol a customer to a milestone/streak
post.description: This API helps in enrolling users into a milestone/streak

periodName.description: Name of the period/cycle into which the user has to be enrolled/re-enrolled in the case of Milestones. Also, period names can be found from the UI of the milestone. In the case of Streaks, this field itself is not needed.

initialBalance.description: The initial balance amount assigned to the customer. This could be 0 or any other number, and when a user enrols with initial balance, the amount of targets needs to be achieved will be decreased by same value. If this given as NULL in the case or re-enrol, then the user's target value will start from the same value at which the un-enrol happened before. Initial balance field won't work for streaks.

resetStreakStatus.description: This field is only for streaks. If this is false, user will continue from the streak value that is present before the un-enrol from the streak. If this is marked as true during re-enrol, then the streak value of the user will be reset & it's like starting fresh.

post.summary: Unenrol users from a milestone and streak

customerId.description: Unique ID of the customer who needs to be un-enrolled from the milestone/streak.

message.example: User is not enrolled to this target

post.summary: Check the Validity of Milestone / Target Name
post.description: Check the uniqueness of a milestone target name.

type.description: Milestone / target to check the validity for. You can check for active, inactive and user-created challenge related milestones.

value.description: Name to be checked for uniqueness. The name is case-insensitive, meaning "Target" and "target" are considered the same.

get.description: Retrieves the details of a specific event call based on the reference ID of the request.

parameters.name: refId
parameters.description: Pass the reference ID of the API call to fetch details. Reference ID is a combination of {orgId}{uniqueId}. parameters.name: webHookId
parameters.description: Identifier for the webhook.

active.description: Indicates if the webhook is active.

customerIdentifiersToBeEnriched.description: List of customer identifiers enrichment available in the payload.

eventNames.description: List of event names that trigger the webhook.

maxAllowedConnections.description: Maximum allowed concurrent connections for this webhook.

methodType.description: HTTP method used by the webhook. Example: POST, PUT, GET or DELETE.

slaInSeconds.description: Expected delivery time of the event notification in seconds. This is used to track notifications that took more time than the SLA set.

webHookHeaders.description: Headers sent with the webhook request.

webHookUrl.description: URL where the webhook sends its requests.
